By Gracie Daw

The campaign has over 500 signatures from students and demands that the University of York end their contract with Circuit Laundry

By James Clay

By James Clay

University announces death of Long Boi

By Gracie Daw

The University released a statement on the Radio 1 Breakfast show saying they were "forced to conclude he has passed away"

York least cost effective UK city for students

A recent student poll has revealed that York is the least cost-effective city for students in the UK (Thumbnail credit Image credit: University of York)

Knifeman jailed for attack on York student

The knifeman responsible for stabbing a University of York student in June in an unprovoked attack has been given a six year prison sentence (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: York Press)

Sports tent to remain open for another six years

Sam Asfahani, the York Sport President, announced this afternoon that the lease on the Sports Centre Tent has been extended by six years following consultations with the Council

New developments on Heslington campuses

Developments and refurbishments are underway to help the University of York expand its capacity to house and educate more students on both Heslington campuses (Thumbnail credit Artist's impression of a first floor seating area in the JBM Library. Image credit: University of York)

York archaeologists unearth Britain's oldest dwelling

Archaeologists from the University of York have unearthed Britain's oldest house, dating back 11,500 years (Thumbnail credit York Archaeology Professor Dr Nicky Milner works on the Starr Carr site. Photo credit: The Guardian)

Further investigations in Claudia Lawrence inquiry

A number of new investigations have taken place this week in relation to the ongoing Claudia Lawrence inquiry, despite the news last week that the investigation is to significantly scaled down

Student dies in York home after suspected drug overdose

James Alexander Ednie Matthews, a 23-year-old University of York student, was found dead in his home on Wednesday afternoon, after a suspected drug overdose (Thumbnail credit Police outside Matthews' house in Tang Hall where he collapsed. Photo credit: York Press)

York sports clubs face sports hall closures

A number of the University's sports teams could be left without facilities for training and fixtures

NUS criticises York and 'greedy' universities for bursary shortfall

Figures published today have revealed inconsistencies between older and newer institutions in their spending of additional income from top-up fees

York success on University Challenge

The University of York University Challenge team have gone through to the second round of the popular university game show

Club Salvation suffers large scale fire damage

A fire broke out in the smoking area of the Club Salvation this morning, beginning just after the club closed at 4am (Thumbnail credit Fire damage at Club Salvation. Image credit: York Press)

Claudia Lawrence investigation to be significantly scaled down

The number of officers involved in the Claudia Lawrence investigation is due to be significantly reduced, as well as the amount of resources allocated to the case

'Waverun' set to expand to the global market

"Waverun", the promotional text message service set up by York students, is said to be planning to expand into the global market

Important new research uncovered at York

Research conducted by the University of York has made regional and national news this week

Cycle stores to be built at Heslington East

Cycle stores are set to be built at Heslington East as part of the new campus' continuing expansion

Graduate tax proposal described as 'unlikely'

The BBC has reported this week that a senior Conservative source has said that the government rejects the idea of a graduate tax system (Thumbnail credit Vince Cable MP. Photo: dspender via Flickr Creative Commons)

York Councillor proposes housing restrictions for students

York Councillor, Roger Pierce, is calling for plans to restrict students from living in residential areas surrounding the University, such as Badger Hill, Garrow Hill and Newland Park (Thumbnail credit Image source: York Press)

Men arrested over knife crimes

Two men from York have been arrested following a local incident on Saturday, resulting in the discovery of a dangerous weapon

YUSU acknowledges employment problems

YUSU told <em>Nouse</em> yesterday that "employability is an area identified by the University as being weak and the University is going through the process of approving an employability strategy to get York on par with comparator institutions"

York scores 88 per cent in employment rate statistics

The University of York has scored 88.3 per cent in employment rate statistics released yesterday by the Higher Education Statistics Authority (HESA)

Keith Lilley to leave York

Director of Facilities Management, Keith Lilley, will be leaving the University of York at the end of this academic year

Government outlines plans for graduate tax system

Vince Cable, the Business Secretary, has outlined plans today for a new graduate tax system

Council supports extra PS1 million for University pool

On-going plans for the construction of a swimming pool in York have now seen the City of York Council suggesting to borrow an additional million pounds to support the project

York scores highly on LGBT University Guide

The University of York has scored eight out of ten checklist points on the Stonewall 'Gay by Degree' University Guide

Sexual offences reported in York highest for five years

New police figures have revealed that the number of sexual offences in York have reached their highest level in five years, despite a fall in numbers in almost all other crimes

University loses bid for York City Stadium

The University has lost its battle to be chosen as the location of the new York City Community Stadium

Halifax student in 'cage of freedom'

Tomorrow at 9am will mark the completion of a week spent living in a cage for a York student and his teammate

YUSU and N-Dubz's manager respond to Summer Ball headline cancellation

YUSU and N-Dubz's manager have today issued statements, responding to student frustration over the fact that the headline act for this year's Summer Ball pulled out

N-Dubz pull out of Summer Ball

Headlining act N-Dubz have pulled out of the annual Summer Ball this evening

Swimming pool campaign launched to encourage community access
